result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Alba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roberto Alba is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roberto Alba was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Defendant Roberto Alba in court with Attorney Peter L Ramirez.   Micha A. Schwab and Lucas Bennowitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Amended Complaint is filed by the State.  Attorney Ramirez objects to Amended Complaint.  Request bifurcation of counts.  Jury Instructions discussion.  Motions in Limine discussion.  State moves to dismiss 15TR100.  State requests a Ludwig hearing - offer extended:  Plea to Ct 3:  fine + CC, 30 days jail, 12 month D.L. Revo, no IID.  

BTC:  Evidence is the same, not altered in any way - Amended Complaint is allowed/Ct 2 as filed.  15TR100 is dismissed without prejudice however testimony is permitted.  

Amended Criminal Complaint - P-NG to Ct 2.  BTC:  P.C. Found.  Def will accept offer to Ct 3.  Cts 1 & 2:  Dismissed w/prej.

P- Alford Plea
Finding of guilt.  

Statement by Attorney Ramirez.  Statement by Defendant.  Statement by Sasha Fernandez/Def's girlfriend.  

BTC:  Ct 3:  15 days jail, $350.00 + CC,  1 yr D.L. revo.  No IID.  AODA assessment.  No DNA sample.  Huber for employment and child care.  PPP of $50.00 per month starting 03-01-17, FTP 7 days jail for contempt.  Report-In date on 02-04-17 by 8:30 a.m.  May serve in Milwaukee County if Racine County rules are followed.  
Cts 1& 2:  Dismissed, w/prejudice.

Jury trial on February 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

It is hereby Orderd as follows:  1) Pursuant to the attached letter of 09-14-16, the defendant is ordered to report to Racine County Alternative Program on or before 10-07-16, for the purpose of transferring his bond monitoring.  2) The bond requirement of testing on 08-30-16 and 09-13-16, were waived by the Court because the defendant was not required to appear at the court proceedings; and therefore, no bond violation occured.  3) All other conditions of bond remain in effect.

to appear and act.
Status conference at 11-23-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
